note.p: Death: His house in Suffolk Street, Pall Mall, Westminster (January 1739)

Career: Practised in the Principality of Orange; a Huguenot, he fled France on account of his religion and settled first in Copenhagen, then London, where he had a successful practice; naturalised British (1688); lectured on anatomy and physiology; Governor of the French Hospital (1729); corresponded with Sir Hans Sloane (FRS 1685)
Memberships: Corresponding Member of Academie Royale des Sciences
